Description:
OverviewThis position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.Provide planning, engineering, and integration oversight to assist the COMUSNAVCENT/5FLT N6, CMF Chief of Staff (COS), and Coalition Officer(s) in the effective planning and management of Combined Enterprise Regional Information Exchange System (CENTRIXS), Battle Information Collection and Exploitation System (BICES), Coalition Partner Network (CPN-X), and other systems as deemed applicable by the COR in accordance with N6 requirements. TS-SCI Clearance required.ResponsibilitiesMajor Job Activities: Act as technical liaison between the COMUSNAVCENT N6, Central Command (CENTCOM) J6 staff, Foreign Disclosure Officer (FDO), and the Navy International Program Office (IPO).
Support CMF assigned Task Forces and CMF personnel in various working groups, information meetings, exercises, and conferences as required by the N6 and approved by the Contracting Officer (KO).
Attend daily recurring meetings to ensure technical situational awareness and provide SME-level oversight feedback as necessary.
Respond to emergent tasking and outages as instructed by the Contracting Officer (KO).
Provide support on-site during core hours and, as needed, additional hours to accommodate meetings, troubleshooting efforts, and exercises.Material & Equipment Directly Used: Navy classified and unclassified C4ISR computer systems and ONE-NET.Working Environment: Candidate will work primarily in computer facilities at Naval commands in an office or computer equipment room environment. Work outside of normal work week hours will be required to participate in meetings, troubleshooting efforts, and installations or upgrades. Physical Activities: Personnel may be required to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time.  Individual must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection of installed computer and network equipment.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications:BS in Information Technology (or equivalent technical degree) and 5+ years technical experience in related discipline required.
IAT Level III Certification (CASP+ CE, CCNP Security, CISA, CISSP (or Associate) GCED or GCIH) with CE required.
5+ years’ experience with Navy or DoD Networks (SIPRNET, NIPRNET, SCI).
5+ years’ experience C4I Systems experience: BICES, GCCS-J/M, FMV, Coalition Partner Network (CPN-X), CENTRIXS/other C2 Systems Administration.
Active DoD TS-SCI Security Clearance.Experience / Skills: Planning, engineering, and integration oversight to the COMUSNAVCENT/5FLT N6, CMF Chief of Staff (COS), and Coalition Officer(s) in the effective planning and management of Combined Enterprise Regional Information Exchange System (CENTRIXS), Battle Information Collection and Exploitation System (BICES), Coalition Partner Network (CPN-X).
Detailed knowledge of MOC C2 systems to include knowledge of fleet communications and architectures.
Must be able to communicate well both orally and in writing.
Must be able to communicate well with senior Navy / DoD officials and technical personnel.
Candidate must be able to provide training remotely and in person.Supervisory / Budget Responsibilities:  N/AWe are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.
